instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
threads.message:
Hi MacBook 15" 2008 board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
It would not power on but I repaired it so it now powers on but Beeps once every five secconds. This goes on forever.
According to Apple's support site this indicates a RAM issue or RAM not being detected by the Mac.
Have tried swapping out the RAM but no luck.

The initial repair I did was replacing <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and the components surrounding it and rebuilt alot of the tracks around that area. I think this area may have had liquid damage or the charger used was a knock off one.

Any help appreciated. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
threads.message:
Do you get correct L7700/80 voltages?
Also check L7330 and L7100.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
threads.message:
So you still have problems on <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> area.
Post its voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
threads.message:
They are both good. No short on cap and resistance on <RESISTOR>R7883</RESISTOR> = 9.93K ohms (measured in circuit)
Is <SIGNAL>P1V8S0_EN</SIGNAL> too low at 1.5v ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on but....
threads.message:
It should be 3V, as it comes from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S2_L_R</SIGNAL>.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7883</CAPACITOR> and check again the signal.
If still low, change <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.
